title: Eutelsat orders 100 LEO satellites to replenish OneWeb constellation
summary:
Eutelsat has ordered 100 broadband satellites from Airbus Defence and Space to start replenishing its OneWeb low Earth orbit constellation in a few years.
The post Eutelsat orders 100 LEO satellites to replenish OneWeb constellation appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: NASA Missions Spot Cosmic ‘Wreath’ Displaying Stellar Circle of Life
summary: Since antiquity, wreaths have symbolized the cycle of life, death, and rebirth. It is fitting then that one of the best places for astronomers to learn more about the stellar lifecycle resembles a giant holiday wreath itself. summary:

title: Jovian Vortex Hunters Spun Up Over New Paper
summary: Jumping Jupiter! The results are in, storm chasers! title: Orion Spacecraft Tested in Ohio After Artemis I Mission
summary: Making the voyage 1.4 million miles around the Moon and back — the farthest a spacecraft built for humans has ever gone — the Orion spacecraft has faced a battery of tests over the years. title: Themis Reusable Rocket Takes Shape as ArianeGroup Completes Fit Check
summary:
ArianeGroup has brought the main elements of the Themis reusable booster demonstrator together for the first time during a “full-fit check.” This milestone paves the way for the demonstrator’s inaugural test, which is expected to take place in 2025. Themis is a 28-metre tall reusable rocket stage demonstrator developed by ArianeGroup under an ESA contract. […]

title: ESA 2024 Highlights: flight of the Ariane 6
summary: In 2024, ESA continued to drive Europe’s innovation and excellence in space, equipping the continent with advanced tools and knowledge to address global and local challenges. The year saw pioneering missions, cutting-edge satellites and the pivotal restoration of Europe’s independent access to space.
